sen.j: 紀伊田辺藩（きいたなべはん）は、紀州徳川家の家老三河安藤氏が治めた藩で、歴代紀州藩主を補佐し、紀伊国に所領を与えられた。
sen.e: The Kii Tanabe domain is the one governed by the Mikawa Ando clan, the chief retainer of Kishu Tokugawa family, and helped the successive lord of Kishu domain and granted a fief in the Province of Kii.

The Kii Tanabe domain was governed by the Mikawa Ando clan, who were the chief retainers of the Kishu Tokugawa family and were granted the fief in the Kii Province for helping successive lords of Kishu.
sen.cmt: Engish of first translation is poor. Reworked sentence to make it read more naturally.
sen.e: The Kii Tanabe domain was governed by the Mikawa Ando clan, who were the chief retainers of the Kishu Tokugawa family and were granted the fief in Kii Province for helping successive lords of Kishu.
sen.cmt: the Kii Province の定冠詞 the 不要

sen.j: ただし、あくまで紀州徳川家の家臣であり、徳川将軍家と関係では陪臣となり、江戸幕府のもとでは独立の藩として認められていなかった。
sen.e: However, it was still a vassal of the Kishu Tokugawa family and a Baishin, indirect vassal of Tokugawa shogun family, and was not approved as an independent domain by the Edo Shogunate.

Note, however, that the clan was no more than a vassal of the Kishu Tokugawa family and an indirect vassal, or Baishin, of the Tokugawa shogun family and the domain was not approved as an independent domain by the Edo Shogunate.
sen.cmt: Changed to the subject to "the clan" for clarity.
sen.e: Note, however, that the clan was no more than a vassal of the Kishu Tokugawa family and an indirect vassal, or Baishin, of the Tokugawa shogun family and the domain was not approved as an independent domain by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: Edo shogunate→Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)

sen.j: 浅野氏が紀伊国を支配していた頃は、一族の浅野知近が領していた。
sen.e: In the period when the Asano clan governed the Province of Kii, Tomochika ASANO of the family ruled the province.
In the period when the Asano clan controlled the Kii Province, Tomochika ASANO was the ruler
sen.cmt: Changed Province of Kii to Kii Province as per term list of July 31st.
sen.e: Tomochika ASANO ruled Kii Province while it was under the control of the Asano clan.
sen.cmt: 不自然な言い回し、構文の間違いを修正。“Kii”.直前の定冠詞は不要。

sen.j: 元和 (日本)5年（1619年）7月、徳川家康の十男・徳川頼宣が紀州藩主に封じられたとき、その付家老として遠江国掛川城主・安藤直次が付けられた。
sen.e: When Yorinobu TOKUGAWA, the 10th son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, was appointed to the lord of the Kishu domain in July 1619, Naotsugu ANDO, the lord of Kakegawa Castle in the Province of Totomi was assignedf attendant chief retainer.

When Yorinobu TOKUGAWA, the 10th son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, was appointed as the lord of the Kishu domain in July 1619, Naotsugu ANDO, the lord of Kakegawa Castle in the Totomi Province, was assigned to the post of attendant chief retainer.
sen.cmt: Changed "assigned to attendant chief retainter" to "assigned to the post of attendant chief reteainer".
sen.e: When Yorinobu TOKUGAWA, the 10th son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, was appointed as the lord of the Kishu domain in July 1619, Naotsugu ANDO, the lord of Kakegawa Castle in Totomi Province, was assigned to the post of attendant chief retainer.
sen.cmt: the Totomi Province の定冠詞 the 不要

sen.j: 直次は紀伊田辺（現在の和歌山県田辺市）に3万8,000石の所領と田辺城 (紀伊国)を与えられた。
sen.e: Naotsugu was given the domain of 38,000 koku in Kii-Tanabe (present Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture) and Tanabe-jo Castle (the Province of Kii).
Naotsugu was given the domain with a yield of 38,000 koku in Kii-Tanabe (present Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture) and Tanabe-jo Castle (Kii Province).
sen.cmt: Changed Province of Kii to Kii Province as per term list of July 31st.
sen.e: Naotsugu was given the domain with a yield of 38,000 koku in Kii-Tanabe (present Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture) and Tanabe-jo Castle (Kii Province).

sen.j: 安藤氏の歴代藩主は、紀州藩の執政として紀州藩政に参与することが多かったため、和歌山城下に住む者が多かった。
sen.e: Many of the successive lord of the domain from the Ando clan lived near the Wakayama-jo Castle because they had often participated in administration of the Kishu domain as the executive of the domain.
Since the successive lords from the Ando clan were often active in the administration the Kishu domain, they tended to live near Tanabe-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: Wakayama=Tanabe, but best to stick to Tanabe-jo all the way through.
sen.e: Since the successive lords from the Ando clan were often active in the administration of the Kishu domain, they tended to live near Tanabe-jo Castle.

sen.j: そのため、田辺城には城代として直次の従弟である安藤直隆の子孫が務めていたが、歴代藩主は田辺入りすることも多かった。
sen.e: In this context, the descendants of Naotaka ANDO, a cousin of Naotsugu, served as the chief vassal of the Tanabe-jo Castle, and the past lords had often visited Tanabe.
Thus, while the descendants of Naotaka ANDO, a cousin of Naotsugu, served as the chief vassals of the Tanabe-jo Castle, they were often visited by the lords.
sen.cmt: Reworked the sentence for more natural English.
sen.e: Thus, while the descendants of Naotaka ANDO, a cousin of Naotsugu, served as the chief vassals of the Tanabe-jo Castle, they were often visited by the lords.

sen.j: 藩内では、安永6年（1777年）6月には米騒動、天明6年（1786年）12月には米価昂騰が原因で騒動が起こった。
sen.e: In the domain, a rice riot happened in June 1777 and another fray caused by skyrocketing rice price in December 1786.
A rice riot of unknown cause took place in the domain in June 1777 and a further rice riot, this time caused by a skyrocketing rice price, took place in December 1786.
sen.cmt: Added "of unknown cause" to balance the sentence.
sen.e: A rice riot of unknown cause took place in the domain in June 1777 and a further rice riot, this time caused by skyrocketing rice prices, took place in December 1786.
sen.cmt: 間違いではないが慣用的ではない。 ”a skyrocketing rice price” -> “skyrocketing rice prices”

sen.j: また、幕末期には海防が重視され、藩内に大砲28門、砲台築造などが行なわれた。
sen.e: In the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate, naval defense was emphasized, and 28 pieces of ordinance and batteries were constructed in the clan.
In the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate, naval defense became a priority, and 28 guns and gun emplacements were constructed in the domain.
sen.cmt: from the phrase "guns and gun emplacements" it is implicit that the guns are large guns.
sen.e: In the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate, naval defense became a priority, and 28 guns and gun emplacements were constructed in the domain.

sen.j: その一方で田辺与力騒動なども起こった。
sen.e: On the other hand, there were also the riot of Yoriki TANABE.
A further riot was the riot of Yoriki TANABE.
sen.cmt: Removed "on the other hand", since there is no contrast being expressed here.
sen.e: A further riot was the riot of Yoriki TANABE.

sen.j: 安藤家といえば、直次の弟安藤重信をはじめ、多くの人物が幕閣となり、幕府の中枢を担った。
sen.e: The Ando family is the family which played a central role of the Shogunate as many people were assigned to the cabinet officials of the Shogunate, including Shigenobu ANDO, the younger brother of Naotsugu,

The Ando family played a central role of the Shogunate with a number of members, inlcuding including Shigenobu ANDO, the younger brother of Naotsugu, being appointed as cabinet officials in the Shogunate.
sen.cmt: "the Ando family is the the family that" is heavy-handed English. I reworked the sentenc to make it read better.
sen.e: The Ando family played a central role in the Shogunate with a number of members, including Shigenobu ANDO, the younger brother of Naotsugu, being appointed as cabinet officials in the Shogunate.

sen.j: 領土も磐城平藩を領するなどしたが、三河安藤氏の宗家はこの紀州徳川家を支えた安藤家であり、他の安藤家は分家である。
sen.e: It also gained the domain of Iwaki-Taira as its territory, and the head family of the Mikawa Ando clan is this one which supported the Kishu Tokugawa family, and any other Ando clan are the branch families.

The Ando family also came into possesion of the domain of Iwaki-Taira, but the main line of the Mikawa Ando clan was that which supported the Kishu Tokugawa family, and other Ando familes are branch families.

The Ando family also came into possession of the domain of Iwaki-Taira, but the main line of the Mikawa Ando clan was that which supported the Kishu Tokugawa family, and other Ando families are branch families.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）、明治政府の計らいによって独立の藩と認められて立藩した。
sen.e: In 1868, it was established as a clan when it was approved as an independent domain by the arrangement of the Meiji Government.
In 1868 Tanabe was established as an independent domain by approval of the Meiji Government.
sen.cmt: The first translation seems to be inaccurate. I have retranslated the source.
sen.e: In 1868 Tanabe was established as an independent domain by approval of the Meiji Government.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）の廃藩置県で廃藩となり、田辺県を経て和歌山県に編入された。
sen.e: The domain was abolished because of the abolition of domain system in 1871 and transferred to Wakayama Prefecture after it belonged to Tanabe Prefecture.
With the abolition of the domain system in 1871, Tanabe domain first became Tanabe Prefecture and then Wakayama Prefecture.
With the abolition of the domain system in 1871, Tanabe domain first became Tanabe Prefecture and then Wakayama Prefecture.

tit.e: The chronological order of the Lords.
tit.cmt: フィードバックにより統一しました。

sen.e: 38,000 koku (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family and establishment was in 1868).
38,000 koku (governed by hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family and established as independent domain in 1868).
sen.cmt: Reworked to make the English more natural.
sen.e: 38,000 koku (governed by hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family and established as an independent domain in 1868).
sen.cmt: 不定冠詞が必要。”as independent”->”as an independent”

sen.j: 安藤直裕（なおひろ、16代の再勤）
sen.e: Naohiro ANDO (the 16th head was assigned again)
sen.cmt: 意味が明確になるように修正。
